channel.title: Comments on: Jack Doyle How Can I Make JavaScript API Docs Like You?
channel.description: Manage Your Code Snippets with codeBelt | Code Examples / Tutorials / Articles

item.title: By: robert
item.dc:creator: robert
item.description: Only played around with it for 15 minutes but YUIDoc looks promising. Once I have time to figure out how to change themes with GruntJS I will try to create a asDoc theme. Checkout my <a href="https://codebelt.github.io/blog/javascript/yuidoc-javascript-documentation-tutorial-gruntjs/" title="YUIDoc JavaScript Documentation Tutorial GruntJS" rel="nofollow">YUIDoc JavaScript Documentation Tutorial</a>.
item.content:encoded: Only played around with it for 15 minutes but YUIDoc looks promising. Once I have time to figure out how to change themes with GruntJS I will try to create a asDoc theme. Checkout my YUIDoc JavaScript Documentation Tutorial.

item.title: By: Jack
item.dc:creator: Jack
item.description:
Hey Robert. Your post made me smile. To answer your question, I couldn't find any decent JS doc generators (at least when I looked a while back), and since the JS flavor of GSAP is a port of the AS3 one, I just copied the AS3 files with all the comments and used Adobe's asdoc generator. Of course I customized the docs where necessary for JS-specific stuff. If you find any good tools for generating JS docs, I'm all ears.
Happy tweening!
item.content:encoded:
Hey Robert. Your post made me smile. To answer your question, I couldn’t find any decent JS doc generators (at least when I looked a while back), and since the JS flavor of GSAP is a port of the AS3 one, I just copied the AS3 files with all the comments and used Adobe’s asdoc generator. Of course I customized the docs where necessary for JS-specific stuff. If you find any good tools for generating JS docs, I’m all ears.

Happy tweening!
